g.text: [1] R.A. Zhachuk, A.A. Shklyaev, Universal building block for (1 1 0)-family silicon and germanium surfaces, Appl. Surf. Sci. 494
[2] A.A. Stekolnikov, J. Furthmüller, F. Bechstedt, Long-range surface reconstruction: Si(110)-(16
[3] T. Yamasaki, K. Kato, T. Uda, T. Yamamoto, T. Ohno, First-principles theory of Si(110)-(16
unveiling origin of pentagonal scanning tunneling microscopy images, Appl. Phys. Exp. 9 (2016) 035501,
[4] N. Troullier, J.L. Martins, Efﬁcient pseudopotentials for plane-wave calculations, Phys. Rev. B 43 (1991) 1993,
[5] J.M. Soler, E. Artacho, J.D. Gale, A. García, J. Junquera, P. Ordej
anchez-Portal, The SIESTA method for ab initio order-N
materials simulation, J. Phys. Condens. Matter 14 (2002) 2745,
[6] J.P. Perdew, Y. Wang, Accurate and simple analytic representation of the electron-gas correlation energy, Phys. Rev. B 45
[7] J. Tersoff, D.R. Hamann, Theory of the scanning tunneling microscope, Phys. Rev. B 31 (1985) 805,
[8] W. Kohn, L.J. Sham, Self-consistent equations including exchange and correlation effects, Phys. Rev. 140 (1965) A1133,
omez-Herrero, A.M. Baro, WSxM: a software for scanning
probe microscopy and a tool for nanotechnology, Rev. Sci. Instrum. 78 (2007) 013705,
[10] R. Zhachuk, J. Coutinho, K. Palot
as, Atomic and electronic structure of the Si(331)-(12
[11] H.J. Monkhorst, J.D. Pack, Special points for Brillouin-zone integrations, Phys. Rev. B 13 (1976) 5188,
[12] T. An, M. Yoshimura, I. Ono, K. Ueda, Elemental structure in Si(110)-
a, D.R. Bowler, K. Tomatsu, K. Nakatsuji, F. Komori, K. Miki, Electronic structure of Si(110)-(16
studied by scanning tunneling spectroscopy and density functional theory, Phys. Rev. B 84 (2011) 115317,
